Methods

_checkPositionChanges

() private

Defined in src/fullscreen-1.0.0.js:357

Called when an event that has affected the sizing of the Game during fullscreen has occured. This method is charged with recalcuating any coordinates/styles needed.

_onChange

(
  • event
)
private

Defined in src/fullscreen-1.0.0.js:333

Executed when the fullscreen state changes. This method is excuted by change events of the browser and should as such should not be called directly.

Parameters:

  • event Event

_recalculateStyles

() private

Defined in src/fullscreen-1.0.0.js:372

Recalculates and applys styles that need to occur onto the targetElement (only if the targetElement is the game container). Note that it is assumed that the browser is in fullscreen mode when this method is called. Method used for internal calls only.

_removeStyles

() private

Defined in src/fullscreen-1.0.0.js:426

Removes all styles that may have been applied because of going into fullscreen mode.

_updateStageScale

() private

Defined in src/fullscreen-1.0.0.js:410

Recalculates the scale on the stage, which is used by the Pointer. This is a workaround.

boot

() private

Defined in src/fullscreen-1.0.0.js:214

Executed when the DOM and all core Game managers have been loaded. Checks for support of the fullscreen API.

checkSupport

() public

Defined in src/fullscreen-1.0.0.js:454

Checks support of the fullscreen API. If support is found, then it maintains the correct methods for enabling/disabling FullScreen.

exitFullscreen

() public

Defined in src/fullscreen-1.0.0.js:298

Exits the game from Fullscreen mode.

launchFullscreen

() public

Defined in src/fullscreen-1.0.0.js:278

Launches the game into Fullscreen mode.

toggleFullscreen

() public

Defined in src/fullscreen-1.0.0.js:315

Toggles the FullScreen state.

update

() private

Defined in src/fullscreen-1.0.0.js:437

The update loop for this Plugin.

Properties

_cancelFullscreen

String private

Defined in src/fullscreen-1.0.0.js:108

Used when checking to see if the Fullscreen API is supported. If support is found, then this will maintain a reference to the correct method for canceling fullscreen.

_requestFullscreen

String private

Defined in src/fullscreen-1.0.0.js:97

Used when checking to see if the Fullscreen API is supported. If support is found, then this will maintain a reference to the correct method for requesting fullscreen.

_updateStage

Booleab private

Defined in src/fullscreen-1.0.0.js:119

When set to true, this will force Kiwi to recalculate the offset/scale of the container. Implemented currently as a fix, since changing css styles do not take effect immediately.

container

HTMLElement public

Defined in src/fullscreen-1.0.0.js:222

A reference back to the container element that the game currently exists inside.

game

Kiwi.Game public

Defined in src/fullscreen-1.0.0.js:77

The game that this Fullscreen Plugin current exists on.

height

Boolean public

Defined in src/fullscreen-1.0.0.js:197

Returns the height of the window. This is the innerWidth/Height of the browser. READ ONLY.

isFullscreen

Boolean public

Defined in src/fullscreen-1.0.0.js:153

If the game is currently in fullscreen mode or not. This is READ ONLY.

onEnter

Kiwi.Signal public

Defined in src/fullscreen-1.0.0.js:130

Dispatches events when the game enters fullscreen.

onLeave

Kiwi.Signal public

Defined in src/fullscreen-1.0.0.js:140

Dispatches events when the game leaves fullscreen.

supported

Boolean public

Defined in src/fullscreen-1.0.0.js:87

If the Fullscreen API is support

targetElement

HTMLElement public

Defined in src/fullscreen-1.0.0.js:231

The targeted element that the fullScreen API will apply to. This will only take affect when the fullScreen API is supported, and if you change the targetted element then the game will not be constraited to the browser window.

width

Boolean public

Defined in src/fullscreen-1.0.0.js:180

Returns the width of the window. This is the innerWidth/Height of the browser. READ ONLY.
